intro: Diodia tetracocca, commonly known as purple Jessamine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly waxy texture. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
